acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=0.06mg/L of the fish (Fathead Minnows) (CERI Hazard Data, 2002).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of >5,000mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-31 (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation of dust) value of 920mg/L (4 hours) (CERI Hazard Data 2001-31 (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 80mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 80mg/kg and 98mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-31 (2002)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A4 by ACGIH (2001) and Group 3 by IARC (1987).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF=98(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 5%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "flammable" by ICSC (2004). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#1673(o-,m-,p-)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in IARC 16 (1978) and PATTY (4th, 2000).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 400degC (ICSC,2004)

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on fertility of parental generation and development of filial generation, described in MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004) and CERI Hazard Data 2001-31 (2002).

respiratory_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause allergy or asthma symptoms or breathing difficulties if inhaled
respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the description of human health effects in CERI Hazard Data 2001-31 (2002), MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004) and PATTY (4th, 1999): "asthmatic symptoms were observed following exposure to p-phenylenediamine."

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#1673(o-,m-,p-)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-31 (2002)): "The substance induced moderate conjunctivitis, with effects resolving by 24 hours." Also based on the description of human health effects (CERI Hazard Data 2001-31 (2002), MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004), PATTY (4th, 1999) and DFGOT vol.6 (1994)): "The substance produces severer symptoms in humans including pain and burning sensation in the eyeball followed by erythema and swelling of lid margin along with chemosis and injection of conjunctiva. In some cases, corneal epithelial erosion, iritis and iridocyclitis, while in more serious cases, corneal ulceration are observed, which may develop into visual impairment and blindness."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on skin irritation tests in rabbits and guinea pigs (CERI Hazard Data 2001-31 (2002) and DFGOT vol.6 (1994)): "mild to moderate irritation" (though the results are not those of 4-hour application). Also based on the description in DFGOT vol.6 (1994) of human health effects: "mildly irritating."

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the description in the report on a number of skin sensitization tests in guinea pigs (CERI Hazard Data 2001-31 (2002) and DFGOT vol.6 (1994)): "Skin sensitization: positive." Also based on the description of human health effects in CERI Hazard Data 2001-31 (2002), PATTY (4th, 1999) and DFGOT vol.6 (1994): The substance possesses a potential for sensitization for human skin. Also due to the fact that the substance is classified into "Skin Sensitizing Substance" by the ad hoc committee of the Japanese Society of Occupational Allergy and Japanese Society of Contact Dermatitis, and "Skin Sensitizing Substance: Group 1" by the Japan Society for Occupational Health.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (liver, nervous system, heart),
Category 2 (skeletal muscle)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement:
Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, nervous system, heart)
May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (skeletal muscle)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "hypertrophy of the liver and spleen, and progressive neurological symptoms were observed; dizziness, gastritis, diplopia, asthenia, desquamative dermatitis were also noted," "jaundice and sub-acute hepatatrophy" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-31 (2002)), and the evidence from animal studies including "degeneration of skeletal muscles" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)), "degeneration of myocardial parenchyma" (ACGIH (7th, 2001)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Categories 1 and 2

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "acute renal failure due to rhabdomyolysis" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)), "necrosis of the muscle tissue," "rhabdomyolysis" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-31 (2002)), "rhabdomyolysis" (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), and the evidence from animal studies including "rhabdomyolysis," "necrosis of the skeletal muscles" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-31 (2002)), "died from acute renal failure caused by rhabdomyolysis" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)), "kidney damage is due to distal renal tubular blockage caused by myoglobin cast" (HSDB (2005)). Although kidney effects are considered secondary, renal failure can be a direct cause of death, so it was included in the target organ list. The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
